et: Middle English {it}distempren, distemperen{/it} "(in medieval physiology) to upset the proper balance of the humors, (of the body) be upset by improper balance of the humors, be diseased, (of a person) be indisposed, anger, (in medicine) to blend (two ingredients), dissolve, dilute, moisten," borrowed from Anglo-French & Medieval Latin; Anglo-French {it}destemprer, destemperer, destremper{/it} "to mix together (ingredients, colors), prepare (a potion), moisten, cleanse" (also continental Old & Middle French, "to soften, dilute"), borrowed from Medieval Latin {it}distemperāre{/it} "to affect (climate, the body) by disproportionate mixture, mix, soak," going back to Late Latin, "to mix (with another liquid), temper, mix badly," from Latin {it}dis-{/it} {et_link|dis-|dis-} + {it}temperāre{/it} "to bring to a proper strength by mixing" {ma}{mat|temper:2|}{/ma}

shortdef: to paint in or with distemper

dt: {bc}a disordered or abnormal bodily state especially of quadruped mammals: such as

{bc}a highly contagious virus disease of canines and especially of dogs that is caused by a morbillivirus (species {it}Canine morbillivirus{/it}) and is marked by fever, leukopenia, and respiratory, gastrointestinal, and neurological symptoms

dt.t: vice and folly are situated not in human nature … but in {wi}distempers{/wi} of intellect

et: probably in part noun derivative of {et_link|distemper:1|distemper:1}, in part from {et_link|dis-|dis-} + {et_link|temper:1|temper:1}
shortdef: a disordered or abnormal bodily state especially of quadruped mammals: such as

a highly contagious virus disease of canines and especially of dogs that is caused by a morbillivirus (species Canine morbillivirus) and is marked by fever, leukopenia, and respiratory, gastrointestinal, and neurological symptoms —called also canine distemper

dt: {bc}a process of painting in which the pigments are mixed with an emulsion of egg yolk, with size, or with white of egg as a vehicle and which is used for painting scenery and murals
{bc}the paint or the prepared ground used in the distemper process

et: probably borrowed (with conformation to {et_link|distemper:2|distemper:2}) from Middle French {it}destrempre{/it} "pigment prepared by the distemper process," noun derivative of {it}destremper{/it} "to soften, dilute, prepare by mixing or diluting (a drink, mortar)," going back to Old French {it}destemprer{/it} {ma}{mat|distemper:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: a process of painting in which the pigments are mixed with an emulsion of egg yolk, with size, or with white of egg as a vehicle and which is used for painting scenery and murals
the paint or the prepared ground used in the distemper process
